pageContext.category: Everett D. Graff Collection of Western Americana; U.S. Western Expansion; Records (Documents)

pages.transcription:
1801   Philip Nolan Esqr. to Mr. Burney
To account of Expences for training and feeding
horses up to the 20th January as pr. accot. rendered                161"
To 3 horses 11 days @ 6 dol. pr. month                                       6"0
To 1 Bald race horse keeping 11 days                                          5"0
To keeping the race Mare 1 month from 1st Jan. to 31                 15.0
To Cash pd. entrance & subscription                                           11.0

                                                                                            ---------------
                                                                                Dollars?   198

Supra Cr
By 1 Roan bald faced horse wt. white feet                         70.0
by Cash pd ballance by Wm. Dunbar                              128.0

                                                                                  ---------------  198"0
                                                                                                   ======
                                                                                                  00.0"?

Received the 2d March 1801 of Wm. Dunbar payment of the 
above account, declaring the same to be perfectly conformed?
to Mr. Nolan's agreement with me

                                                         David Burney

Philip Nolan
Esqr pd. Mr. Burney
128 Dollars

pageContext.title: Bill and receipt for payment of account of Philip Nolan with David Burney, payment being made by William Dunbar, 1801
